tn.text: "in the 1st month." This is the first month of the Hebrew calendar. It marks when God brought the people of Israel out of Egypt. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
"the 2nd year" or "year 2" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: after they came out from the land of Egypt
tn.text: Here "they" refers to the people of Israel. The phrase "came out" means to leave. AT: "after they left the land of Egypt" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Let the people ... at its fixed time of year
tn.text: The word "fixed" means "previously set." This means that this is when the observe it every year. AT: "Let the people ... at the time of year they currently observe it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: On the fourteenth day ... at its fixed time of year
tn.text: This is the set time of year that they celebrate the Passover. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "On the fourteenth day ... and observe it, for this is the time you do celebrate it every year" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"the 14th day" (See:  [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: follow all the regulations, and obey all the decrees
tn.text: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and are combined to emphasize that they needed to obey the commands. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Here the phrase "keep it" is an idiom which means to observe it. AT: "You must observe it" or "You must celebrate it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: keep the Festival of the Passover
tn.text: Here the word "keep" means to observe. AT: "observe the Festival of the Passover" or "celebrate the Festival of the Passover" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: in the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month
tn.text: "in the 1st month, on the 14th day of the month" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: became unclean by the body of a dead man
tn.text: This implies that they touched the dead man, which made them unclean. You can make clear the full meaning of this statement. AT: "became unclean because they touched the body of a dead man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
A person who God considers spiritually unacceptable or defiled is spoken of as if the person were physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here the word "keep" means to observe. AT: "observe the Passover" or "celebrate the Passover" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: because of the dead body of a man
tn.text: This means that they had touched a dead man's body. You can make the full meaning of this statement clear. AT: "because we have touched the body of a dead man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: Why do you keep us from offering the sacrifice ... among the people of Israel?
tn.text: The men ask this question in order to complain that they are not allowed to participate in celebrating the Passover. This rhetorical question can be translated as a statement. AT: "It is not fair that you keep us away from offering the sacrifice ... among the people of Israel." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
set or predetermined
A person who God considers spiritually unacceptable or defiled is spoken of as if the person were physically unclean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This refers to someone touching a dead body. AT: "because you have touched a dead body" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Here the word "keep" means to observe. AT: "observe the Passover" or "celebrate the Passover" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Here the word "keep" means to observe. AT: "observe the Passover" or "celebrate the Passover" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: the second month on the fourteenth day
tn.text: "the 2nd month on the 14th day" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
"at sunset"
"They must eat the Passover lamb"
"with bread made without yeast" or "with bread that contains no yeast"
These are small plants that have a strong and usually bad taste.

tn.ref: or break any of its bones
tn.text: "and they must not break any of its bones"
A person who God considers spiritually acceptable is spoken of as if the person were physically clean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here the word "keep" means to observe. AT: "observe the Passover" or "celebrate the Passover" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: that person must be cut off
tn.text: Here the phrase "cut off" means to be disowned and sent away. AT: "that person must be sent away" or "you must send that person away" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
set or predetermined

tn.ref: That man must carry his sin
tn.text: Here the concept of the man having to bear the consequences of his sin is spoken of as if his sin were a heavy object object that he had to carry. AT: "That man must bear the punishment for his sin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here "you" is plural and refers to the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: he must keep it and do all he commands
tn.text: "that stranger must keep it and do all that Yahweh commands"

tn.ref: keeping the rules of the Passover, and obeying the laws for it
tn.text: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and are used together to emphasize that the stranger must obey all of the rules about the Passover. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
"in the land of Israel"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "the Levites set up the tabernacle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the tent of the covenant decrees
tn.text: This is another name for the tabernacle. See how you translated the phrase "the tabernacle of the covenant decrees" in [[:en:bible:notes:num:01:50|1:50]].

tn.ref: It appeared like fire until morning
tn.text: This refers to the cloud's appearance during the night. Here the cloud is compared to looking like a fire. AT: "During the night the cloud looked like a huge fire until morning" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
It may be helpful to explain that this refers to the cloud being over the tabernacle. AT: "The cloud remained this way over the tabernacle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The cloud's appearance is compared to a huge fire. AT: "it looked like a huge fire at night." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "moved" or "Yahweh took up the cloud" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"the cloud stopped moving"
The word "command" can be expressed as a verb. AT: "When Yahweh commanded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"over the tabernacle"
Here the word "make" means to "set up." AT: "set up their camp" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

This means that the cloud only stayed over the tabernacle for one night. You make make clear the full meaning of this statement. AT: "only from evening until morning" or "over the tabernacle for only one night" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit.  "If the cloud stayed over the tabernacle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: only when the cloud lifted would they journey on
tn.text: "then after the cloud moved they would travel"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "the cloud rose up" (UDB) or "Yahweh took up the cloud" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The word "command" can be expressed as a verb. "what Yahweh commanded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
This can be stated in active form.  AT: "the command that Yahweh had given through Moses" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
